title: British, Irish Leaders Stoke Hopes of Late Brexit Deal
text:
LONDON—British Prime Minister Boris Johnson and his Irish counterpart Leo Varadkar unexpectedly declared Thursday they saw a chance of a Brexit deal, stoking hopes that a last-ditch agreement to get the U.K. out of the European Union could still be in reach and prompting the biggest one-day jump in the British pound against the dollar in more than two years.

Ahead of a critical summit in Brussels next week, Messrs. Varadkar and Johnson met in Northern England to discuss how to unblock Brexit negotiations following a diplomatic...
description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson and his Irish counterpart Leo Varadkar unexpectedly said they saw a chance of a Brexit deal.
